news.title: Aditya Birla Real Estate posts net loss of ₹47.30 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Aditya Birla Real Estate reported a net consolidated loss of ₹47.30 crore in Q1 FY26, a significant downturn from the ₹9.86 crore profit in the same period last year. Total income also decreased to ₹157.41 crore from ₹365.24 crore. Despite this, the company saw a 61% year-on-year increase in booking value, reaching ₹4,225 million.

news.title: Bajaj Housing Finance's net profit up 20.86% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Bajaj Housing Finance showcased strong financial performance in Q1 FY26, reporting a 20.86% increase in net consolidated profit, reaching ₹583.30 crore. The company's total income also grew by 18.55% to ₹2,618.45 crore. With assets under management rising by 24% to ₹1.20,420 crore, the company maintains a healthy financial position with a strong capital adequacy ratio.

news.title: Lodha Developers, Oberoi Realty shares fall up to 6% after block deals
news.para: Shares of Oberoi Realty and Lodha Developers experienced a downturn following substantial block deals worth USD 395 million. Institutional stakes were sold, leading to a 4.16% drop for Oberoi Realty and a 6.64% decline for Lodha Developers. The selling pressure impacted the Nifty realty index, with major stocks trading in the red.

news.title: Lucknow civic body's move to link waste charge, house tax irks residents
news.para: Lucknow residents are criticizing the Lucknow Municipal Corporation's (LMC) decision to link waste collection fees to property tax IDs, citing inconsistent service. The mandatory charges, ranging from Rs 50 to Rs 100 monthly, apply citywide, regardless of garbage collection regularity.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body sounds caution on 351 illegal colonies
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority has identified 351 illegal colonies sprawling across approximately 3,000 acres, cautioning residents against investing in these properties. These colonies, many established in the last few decades, lack legal sanction despite registry processes. The GDA is actively conducting demolition drives and developing an AI system to curb further illegal construction, addressing a long-standing issue.

news.title: Building smarter, greener, and future-ready: Why the real estate industry can't wait any longer
news.para: India's real estate sector, poised for significant growth, faces increasing pressure to embrace sustainability. The Future-Proof Realty series, a collaboration between ETRealty and ETStudios, will explore this transition through conversations with industry leaders. Discussions will cover integrating green materials, improving energy efficiency, and navigating evolving regulations, highlighting the sector's crucial role in a sustainable future.

news.title: PwC India opens new office in Gurugram, sixth in NCR
news.para: PwC India has expanded its footprint in the Delhi-NCR region with a new 1.25 lakh sq ft office in Gurugram's 'DLF Downtown 4'. This sixth office in NCR increases PwC India's capacity to nearly 8,000 people. Chairperson Sanjeev Krishan highlighted the growing demand for their services. The new facility will accommodate over 1,200 employees.

news.title: Kochi: Infopark Phase III land pooling clears key hurdle
news.para: Infopark's Phase III expansion in Kizhakkambalam is nearing reality as the Greater Cochin Development Authority (GCDA) has been officially appointed as the land pooling agency. This follows approval from the local self govt department. The IT department's approval is still pending, but the project envisions a township-model IT hub.

news.title: Ashiana Housing's sales bookings rise 83% to ₹431 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Ashiana Housing Ltd witnessed a significant surge in sales bookings during the first quarter of this fiscal year, soaring by 83% to reach Rs 430.97 crore, driven by robust demand. The company successfully sold 5.95 lakh square feet of property, marking a substantial increase compared to the 4.42 lakh square feet sold in the same period last year.

news.title: No retaining walls along rivers, north, east & south Nagpur homes in high-risk zones
news.para: Rapid urbanization near Nagpur's rivers has heightened flood risks due to the lack of retaining walls. The NMC's Rs57 crore proposal for wall construction awaits state funding, while previous allocations for flood prevention remain largely unutilized. Residents fear a repeat of the 2023 devastation, prompting legal action due to slow progress and pending dues.

news.title: Lucknow: New residential schemes to come up in Banda, Chitrakoot
news.para: UP Housing Board will soon launch two affordable housing schemes in Banda and Chitrakoot. These schemes will be located in prime areas. Most plots are for individual house construction. A greenfield township will be developed across 338 acres in Banda and 161 acres in Chitrakoot. The board will also expand in Varanasi, Unnao, and Moradabad.

news.title: Nisus Finance invests ₹115 crore in Kumar Vibe Projects across Mumbai & Pune
news.para: Kumar Vibe Properties, a joint venture, receives ₹115 crore from Nisus Finance. The investment will support projects in Mumbai and Pune. Residences in Khar West will be priced at ₹7 crore and above. Goregaon West residences will range from ₹3 crore to ₹4.25 crore. NIBM Pune residences will be priced up to ₹1.25 crore.

news.title: Illegal constructions raising the roof and risk in Chandni Chowk
news.para: Chandni Chowk and the Walled City are grappling with widespread illegal construction, leading to congestion and safety concerns. The Supreme Court has intervened, ordering the sealing of unauthorized structures and arrests for violations.

news.title: IndiQube Spaces raises ₹314 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
news.para: IndiQube Spaces secures over ₹314 crore from anchor investors. This happens before its initial public offering. Shares are allotted at ₹237 each. Key investors include Aditya Birla Sun Life MF and Motilal Oswal. The IPO opens on July 23, 2025, and closes on July 25, 2025. The price band is ₹225–₹237 per share.

news.title: Manipal Group’s promoter family buys ₹64 crore apartment in Bengaluru
news.para: Shruti R Pai, wife of Manipal Group's Chairman, has acquired a luxury apartment in Bengaluru's Jayamahal Extension for Rs 64 crore. This transaction highlights a growing trend of high-value apartment purchases in Bengaluru, driven by demand from HNIs and industrialists. The city's luxury real estate market is experiencing a surge, fueled by limited inventory and an increasing number of UHNIs.

news.title: About 60 Sushant Lok houses get final warning for violations in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram's DTCP has escalated enforcement in Sushant Lok 2, issuing restoration orders against over 60 properties. These properties are in violation of building norms and engaging in unauthorized commercial activities. This action follows unheeded notices regarding illegal constructions and commercial operations like coaching centers and salons.

news.title: Homebuyers are 'plotting' deals as land prices climb
news.para: Plotted developments are becoming popular with second-home buyers. These buyers are attracted by appreciation potential and flexibility. Land prices have risen significantly in major cities. Developers are creating plotted communities with amenities.

news.title: Building sites in Ahmedabad under scanner for ‘masking’ air pollution data
news.para: Ahmedabad developers are allegedly manipulating air quality sensors at construction sites. They are covering sensors with wet cloths to show lower pollution levels. The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) implemented rules in 2023 to curb air pollution. These rules mandate air quality sensors at large construction sites. AMC is now working to prevent sensor tampering.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government plans to reintroduce BPS & LRS to tackle illegal constructions
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government is considering reintroducing the Building Penalisation Scheme (BPS) and Layout Regularisation Scheme (LRS) to address the proliferation of illegal structures and layouts. This initiative aims to streamline unauthorized constructions, boost state revenue, and ensure public safety.
